localizedDescriptions.en: Document to communicate information to others, commonly in response to a request from another party.
Identification information about the report.
The status of the entire report. Note: This is not the status of any of the report components.
A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
A person who needs to be represented within the health record.
Details about the discrete components of a person's name, for use within a health record.
The person's identifying first name(s) within the family group or by which they are uniquely socially identified.

annotations.comment: Also known as a specific type of 'Given name'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The part of a name a person usually has in common with some other members of their family, as distinguished from their own given names.

annotations.comment: Also known as 'Family name' or 'Surname'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the person.
Details about a specific type of electronic communication for the person.
The type or medium for electronic communication.

annotations.comment: The range of electronic communication mediums includes, but is not limited to use of : telephone, cellular phone, email, pager, fax, conferencing tool or social media.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; email address; or skype contact name.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The purpose or use for the identified type of electronic communication.
Additional narrative about the electronic communication not captured in other fields.
An identified formal entity or informal grouping of people.

annotations.comment: For example: a company, institution, corporation, department, community group, healthcare practice group, payer/insurer, care team, or a group of neighbours who will act as carers or support.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unstructured name or label for the organisation.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Royal Children's Hospital'; 'ABC District Nursing Service'; 'YNWA Oslo' or 'JB Smith Lawyers'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the organisation.
A physical or postal address for use within a health record.
The unstructured address of the person or organisation.

annotations.comment:
This address line represents a low level of geographical/physical description of a location that, used in conjunction with the other high-level address components i.e. ‘Suburb/Town/Locality’, ‘Postcode’, and ‘State/Territory/Province’, forms a complete geographical/physical address. This data element can be used to represent a landmark, such as "The second house north of the general store" or "At the corner of Smith & Brown Streets.
The content of this data element may be derived from a concatenation of one or more components from CLUSTER.structured_address.
Multiple occurrences allow for as many 'Address' lines, as required. For example: 4 address lines represented as
Apartment 7A,
52 Davis Street,
Carlton North,
Victoria, AUSTRALIA 3042.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of an internal political or geographic district or area within a state, territory or province containing the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of an internal political or geographic district or area within a state, territory or province containing the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of an internal political or geographic division of a country containing the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: Victoria; Alberta.

localizedDescriptions.en: The name of the country containing the address.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: Australia; Canada

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about a specific type of electronic communication for the organisation.
The type or medium for electronic communication.

annotations.comment: The range of electronic communication mediums includes, but is not limited to use of: telephone, cellular phone, email, pager, fax, conferencing tool or social media.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; email address; or skype contact name.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
A container archetype used to hold demographic-related EHR CLUSTER archetypes.
A person who needs to be represented within the health record.
Details about the discrete components of a person's name, for use within a health record.
The person's identifying first name(s) within the family group or by which they are uniquely socially identified.

annotations.comment: Also known as a specific type of 'Given name'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The person's identifying middle name(s) within the family group or by which they are uniquely socially identified.

annotations.comment: Also known as a specific type of 'Given name'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The person's identifying pet name or nickname(s) within the family group or by which they are uniquely socially identified.

annotations.comment: Also known as a specific type of 'Given name'.

localizedDescriptions.en: The part of a name a person usually has in common with some other members of their family, as distinguished from their own given names.

annotations.comment: Also known as 'Family name' or 'Surname'.

localizedDescriptions.en: An additional term placed after all other name components, usually to differentiate the individual from a family member with identical name components.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: 'Junior (Jr)'; 'Senior (Sr)'; 'Second (II)'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identifier associated with the person.
A physical or postal address for use within a health record.
The type of address.

annotations.comment: For example: physical or postal.

localizedDescriptions.en: A physical location that can be visited.
Address used as a destination for mailing letters or parcels.
Address of a physical location, also used as a destination for mail.
The primary purpose or use for the address.
Address of the physical location of a business or office.
Address of where a person is living on a regular basis.
Address of where a person is living on a temporary basis.
The type of address.

annotations.comment:
This address line represents a low level of geographical/physical description of a location that, used in conjunction with the other high-level address components i.e. ‘Suburb/Town/Locality’, ‘Postcode’, and ‘State/Territory/Province’, forms a complete geographical/physical address. This data element can be used to represent a landmark, such as "The second house north of the general store" or "At the corner of Smith & Brown Streets.
The content of this data element may be derived from a concatenation of one or more components from CLUSTER.structured_address.
Multiple occurrences allow for as many 'Address' lines, as required. For example: 4 address lines represented as
Apartment 7A,
52 Davis Street,
Carlton North,
Victoria, AUSTRALIA 3042.

The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The purpose or use for the identified type of electronic communication.
Details related to the time and place of birth and additional non-clinical context around the birth.
Date and time of birth.
A single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time.
The main job title or the role of the individual.

annotations.comment: For example: Chief Executive Officer; Carer; or Student. Each of these job titles or roles may be comprised of multiple duties.

localizedDescriptions.en: An identified formal entity or informal grouping of people.

annotations.comment: For example: a company, institution, corporation, department, community group, healthcare practice group, payer/insurer, care team, or a group of neighbours who will act as carers or support.

annotations.comment: For example: 'Royal Children's Hospital'; 'ABC District Nursing Service'; 'YNWA Oslo' or 'JB Smith Lawyers'.

annotations.comment: Coding with an external terminology is preferred, where possible. For example: Australia; Canada

The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.

An identified human being.
Details about the discrete components of a person's name, for use within a health record.
The person's identifying first name(s) within the family group or by which they are uniquely socially identified.

annotations.comment: For example: area code + landline phone/pager number; country code + mobile phone number; email address; or skype contact name.

localizedDescriptions.en: The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The unique combination of alphanumeric characters, meaningful for the identified type or medium of electronic communication.
The purpose or use for the identified type of electronic communication.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Used for admitted patient only. It signals the beginning of a patient's stay in a health care facility.
Intended mode of treatement.
Inpatient/overnight patient
Outpatient
Emergency patient
Unknown
Assigned patient location when the patient was admitted.
Date/time the patient was admitted.
An individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening for symptoms and signs.

children.name: Are there any symptoms or signs
children.localizedName: Are there any symptoms or signs

localizedNames.en: Are there any symptoms or signs

localizedDescriptions.en: Presence of any relevant symptoms or signs.
Symptoms or signs are present.
Symptoms or signs are not present.
It is not known whether any symptoms or signs are present or absent.
The date/time when any symptoms or signs were first noticed.

annotations.comment: Partial dates are allowed.

localizedDescriptions.en: Grouping of data elements related to screening for a single symptom or sign.
Name of the symptom or sign being screened.
The length of time since onset of the symptom or sign.
An individual- or self-reported questionnaire screening for symptoms and signs.

children.name: Are there any symptoms or signs
children.localizedName: Are there any symptoms or signs

localizedNames.en: Are there any symptoms or signs

localizedDescriptions.en: Presence of any relevant symptoms or signs.
Symptoms or signs are present.
Symptoms or signs are not present.
It is not known whether any symptoms or signs are present or absent.
The date/time when any symptoms or signs were first noticed.

annotations.comment: Partial dates are allowed.

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about all symptoms or signs.
Grouping of data elements related to screening for a single symptom or sign.
Name of the symptom or sign being screened.
The length of time since onset of the symptom or sign.
Assessment of the potential and likelihood of future adverse health effects as determined by identified risk factors.
Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about each possible risk factor.
Identification of the risk factor, by name.

annotations.comment:
For example: hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia, which may be used as part of the overall assessment for cardiovascular disease; or a genetic marker. Coding of 
'Risk factor' with a terminology, where possible.

list.value: Immunocompromised due to disease or treatment
list.label: Immunocompromised due to disease or treatment

localizedDescriptions.en: Narrative description about the risk factor.
The date/time that the risk factor was identified.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Details about a single identified health condition, injury, disability or any other issue which impacts on the physical, mental and/or social well-being of an individual.

annotations.comment: Clear delineation between the scope of a problem versus a diagnosis is not easy to achieve in practice. For the purposes of clinical documentation with this archetype, problem and diagnosis are regarded as a continuum, with increasing levels of detail and supportive evidence usually providing weight towards the label of 'diagnosis'.

localizedDescriptions.en: Identification of the problem or diagnosis, by name.

annotations.comment: Coding of the name of the problem or diagnosis with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

localizedDescriptions.en: Details about travel during an interval of time.
Default, unspecified interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Has the individual travelled during the specified interval?

annotations.comment: Use the Event to set the relevant interval.

localizedDescriptions.en: The individual has travelled within the specified interval of time.
The individual has not travelled within the specified interval of time.
It is unknown whether the individual has travelled within the specified interval of time.
Was the travel domestic, international, or both?
The individual has travelled domestically within the specified interval of time.
The individual has travelled internationally within the specified interval of time.
The individual has travelled both domestically and internationally within the specified interval of time.
Details about a single trip away from the home base.

annotations.comment: The trip has a single departure and return date to their home base. A trip may include visiting many individual places, and these details should be recorded in the Specific destination cluster.

localizedDescriptions.en: The date when the individual left their home base.
Narrative description about the whole trip, especially about potential exposure to health risks.
Details about a single location visited on a trip.
The country visited.
The region visited.

annotations.comment: Different regions within the same country maybe identified if they potentially pose different health risks.

localizedDescriptions.en: The city visited.

annotations.comment: Different cities within the same country or region maybe identified if they potentially pose different health risks.

localizedDescriptions.en: Date of entry to the identified location.
Date of exit from the identified location.
Additional narrative about the stay at the identified location, not captured in other fields.
The date when the individual returned back to their home base.
Additional narrative about the whole trip, not captured in other fields.
A screening questionnaire about potential exposure to a chemical, physical or biological agent which has caused or may cause harm to an individual.
The name of the chemical, physical or biological agent to which an individual may have been exposed.

annotations.comment: Coding of 'Agent' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: 2019-nCoV; or HIV.

localizedDescriptions.en: Presence of any relevant exposure.
The individual has been exposed to the agent.
The individual has not been exposed to the agent.
It is not known whether the individual has been exposed to the agent.
Details about each possible specific exposure circumstance.
The circumstance of possible exposure.

annotations.comment: For example: Travel to an 'at risk' location; exposure to infected body fluids; or worked as a dental technician. Coding of 'Exposure situation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.

list.value: Visited a Health Facility within 14 days
list.label: Visited a Health Facility within 14 days

list.value: Contact with traveler in past 14 days
list.label: Contact with traveler in past 14 days

localizedDescriptions.en: The date/s when the individual was exposed to the agent.

annotations.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

localizedDescriptions.en: The date/s when the individual was exposed to the agent.
The date/s when the individual was exposed to the agent.
Additional narrative about the specific exposure event, not captured in other fields.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource. This is an ADMIN ENTRY wrapper archetype to contain the Care team CLUSTER archetype where it has no natural ENTRY level parent.
Care team details aligned with FHIR resource.
Identifies all people and organizations who are expected to be involved in the care team.
Contacts for patients and organisations (excluding practitioners).
Details of personal name of an individual, provider or third party.
Name in structured format.
Given / personal / first name.
Family name or Surname.
FHIR telecom details.
Telecommunications form for contact point - what communications system is required to make use of the contact.
The communication form is phone.
The communication form is fax.
